definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To inspire boredom in somebody.
examples: Reading books really bores me; films are much more exciting.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To make a hole through something.
( intransitive ) To make a hole with, or as if with, a boring instrument; to cut a circular hole by the rotary motion of a tool.
examples: to bore for water or oil
An insect bores into a tree.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To form or enlarge (something) by means of a boring instrument or apparatus.
examples: to bore a steam cylinder or a gun barrel; to bore a hole

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To make (a passage) by laborious effort, as in boring; to force a narrow and difficult passage through.
examples: to bore one’s way through a crowd

definitions.definition: ( intransitive ) To be pierced or penetrated by an instrument that cuts as it turns.
examples: This timber does not bore well.

definitions.definition: ( intransitive ) To glare (as if to drill a hole with the eyes).
examples: Their eyes bore into my back.

definitions.definition: ( transitive , sports , slang ) To push or drive (a boxer into the ropes, a boat out of its course, etc.).
( intransitive ) To push forward in a certain direction with laborious effort.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To inspire boredom in somebody.
